channel.title: Run.bat help!
channel.description:
When I run, either way or the other I always get an error, this is whats in my client run.bat at the moment, i've tryed running as a administrator but still nothing, and i'm useing Windows 7.
@echo off title Client cd ./Class/ "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx200m Gui 30 0 highmem members 32 pause
It says exception in "main" thread Gui etc....
Could someone help me, and tell me if the code above is right ^.
Regards, James.

item.title: Run.bat help!
item.dc:creator: @revjester revjester
item.description:
@revjester wrote:

[quote=“James-RevolutionX, post:3, topic:369719”]It now says exception in “main” Jframe.[/quote] I’ve had that problem so many times, the problem with your run is that it can’t identify you classpath,
your run should look like this.

@echo off
title Client
cd ./Class/
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -classpath . -Xmx200m Gui 30 0 highmem members 32
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat help!
item.dc:creator: @James-RevolutionX James-RevolutionX
item.description:
@James-RevolutionX wrote:

It now says exception in “main” Jframe.

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat help!
item.dc:creator: @Nathan8888 Nathan8888
item.description:
@Nathan8888 wrote:

Try this (ITs what i use for myself)

@echo off
title Your name
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx1500m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat help!
item.dc:creator: @James-RevolutionX James-RevolutionX
item.description:
@James-RevolutionX wrote:

When I run, either way or the other I always get an error, this is whats in my client run.bat at the moment, i’ve tryed running as a administrator but still nothing, and i’m useing Windows 7.

@echo off
title Client
cd ./Class/
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx200m Gui 30 0 highmem members 32
pause

It says exception in “main” thread Gui etc…

Could someone help me, and tell me if the code above is right ^.

Regards,
James.
